item.title: Four ways to supercharge your scatterplots
item.description: Scatterplots are a go-to visualization with forestry data. Scatterplots show the relationship between two quantitative variables measured on the same object. For example, a tree’s diameter and height. There are a few rules for all scatterplots: The explanatory variable goes on the x-axis. (This is usually the “easier” measurement to collect.) The response variable goes on the y-axis. (This is usually the “harder” measurement to collect.) Each observation is a point on the graph.

item.title: The three kinds of data scientists in forestry
item.description: Data scientists are highly sought after professionals across tens of thousands of companies. And there’s a difference between what a data scientist does and what a statistician does. The field of statistics has been around for centuries, while data science programs at universities are just now beginning to graduate their first students. In statistics, hypotheses are evaluated. In data science, hypotheses are generated. Statistics is often considered a primary data analysis technique, while data science is often considered secondary.
